intro: Tetrastigma liukiuense, commonly known as the Ryukyu grapevine, is a climbing vine native to the Ryukyu Islands of Japan. It belongs to the Vitaceae family and is characterized by its tendrils and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are small, round berries that mature to a dark purple color. Tetrastigma liukiuense is often found growing in humid, shaded environments within tropical and subtropical regions.
